xxl.cursors
Class Taker

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--xxl.cursors.DecoratorCursor
        |
        +--xxl.cursors.Taker
public class Taker
extends DecoratorCursor

A Taker is a DecoratorCursor that returns the next n elements of a given Iterator (lazy evaluation).
The number of elements that should be extracted from the given Iterator is user-specified.

Note: The Input-Iterator is wrapped to a Cursor.

The Taker contains further elements if hasNext is true, i.e. if cursor.hasNext() && number>0. If next is called the next element in the iteration is returned and the number of elements to be extracted from the input-Cursor is decremented.

Example usage: 

 	Taker taker = new Taker(new Enumerator(11), 5);
 		while(taker.hasNext())
 			System.out.print(taker.next() +"; ");
 		System.out.flush();
 		taker.close();
This instance of a Taker extracts the first five elements of the given Enumerator. The Enumerator contains the elements 0,...,10.

So the output that results after consuming the entire Taker is: 

 	0; 1; 2; 3; 4;

See Also:
Iterator, DecoratorCursor

Method Detail

hasNext

public boolean hasNext()
Returns true if the iteration has more elements.
(In other words, returns true if next or peek would return an element rather than throwing an exception.)
The input-Iterator is wrapped to a Cursor and this method returns true if cursor.hasNext() && number>0.
Overrides:
hasNext in class DecoratorCursor
Returns:
true if the Taker has more elements.

next

public Object next()
            throws UnsupportedOperationException
Returns the next element in the iteration.
This element will be removed from the underlying collection, if next is called.
The number of elements to be extracted from the input-Cursor is decremented.
Overrides:
next in class DecoratorCursor
Returns:
the next element in the iteration.
Throws:
NoSuchElementException - iteration has no more elements.

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples to demonstrate the usage and the functionality of this class.
Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
